other_tests.findings: Moderately to poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma infiltrating glandular mucosa beneath squamous mucosa, focal intestinal metaplasia in glandular mucosa consistent with Barrett’s esophagus, and changes in squamous mucosa consistent with reflux esophagitis.
Mass in the distal esophagus, 32 cm from incisors, extending to the gastroesophageal junction.
Adenocarcinoma identified in the gastrohepatic lymph node.
Adenocarcinoma with focal glandular metaplasia, indicating Barrett’s esophagus.
Non-obstructive, hypoechoic mass in distal esophagus (34 to 37 cm from incisors) extending to muscularis propria.
Dramatic decrease in 18F-FDG uptake at gastroesophageal junction and gastrohepatic node.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Decrease in size of mass in the gastroesophageal junction and gastrohepatic node compared with previous studies.
